results.summary: Instrumented bearing for oil cooled starter/generator
results.content: Instrumented bearing for oil cooled starter/generator

descriptionByte:
Scope:

The rotating electrical machine manufacturers are looking for solutions to reduce the mass of these machines. One of them is to increase the rotation speed of these machines. So this solution requires to conduct studies on the bearing health in high speed environment and establish the failure modes in these conditions.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
            Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals".
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules

On 26 January 2015 the link for the ethics review was added to the PartB templates and the comment concerning the definative version being in the submission system was removed.
Please remember that an Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed. See the comments in the Excel table.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened during the first days of the week commencing 26 January 2015.

"},{"approvalDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:58:22 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:57:59 PM","content":"

On 21 January the templates for drafting Part B.I and Part B.II of the proposals were uploaded to the information package of this call. 
An Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

Please note that on 12 Janaury 2015 there were significant updates made to the following topic descriptions. Please see the new version of the Annex III (Topic Documents Document) for details.

  • FRC-02-03
  • FRC-02-05
  • FRC-02-06
  • FRC-02-07
  • FRC-02-08
"}]

results.summary: Evaluate mechanical and fatigue capabilities for diode die in harsh environment
results.content: Evaluate mechanical and fatigue capabilities for diode die in harsh environment

keywords: NUM Numerical Models (including Fast Time Simulati
descriptionByte:
Scope:

Electrical components need to withstand very harsh environment conditions, along with mechanical constraints. Thus analysis need to be conducted to fully characterized mechanical and temperature constraints applied on component die in high cycled stress and to elaborate a mechanical model according to the product duty cycle.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
           Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposal
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Development of MODELICA libraries for ECS and thermal management architectures
results.content: Development of MODELICA libraries for ECS and thermal management architectures

descriptionByte:
Scope:

In order to support the definition of optimized E-ECS architectures extended to thermal management perimeter, this project aims to develop MODELICA libraries (Dymola compatible)  to simulate the performance of such architectures. In particular the applicant will develop a VCS model optimized for both steady state and dynamic modelling. A methodology for coupling electric and thermal architectures will be addressed within this project in order to simulate complete architectures on electrical and thermal aspect by optimizing time computing.    Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents").  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
            Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals".
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

results.summary: Embedded sensors technology for air quality measurement
results.content: Embedded sensors technology for air quality measurement

descriptionByte:
Scope:

This project aims to select and test sensors technologies enabling the measurement of VOCs and ozon concentration in the cabin. An integration analysis in the overall ECs architectures will also be carried out with the member’s support.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
           Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals"
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules

On 26 January 2015 the link for the ethics review was added to the PartB templates and the comment concerning the definative version being in the submission system was removed.
Please remember that an Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed. See the comments in the Excel table.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened during the first days of the week commencing 26 January 2015.

"},{"approvalDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:58:22 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:57:59 PM","content":"

On 21 January the templates for drafting Part B.I and Part B.II of the proposals were uploaded to the information package of this call. 
An Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

Please note that on 12 Janaury 2015 there were significant updates made to the following topic descriptions. Please see the new version of the Annex III (Topic Documents Document) for details.

  • FRC-02-03
  • FRC-02-05
  • FRC-02-06
  • FRC-02-07
  • FRC-02-08
"}]

results.summary: CROR Engine debris Middle level Impact and mechanical test
results.content: CROR Engine debris Middle level Impact and mechanical test

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

These work package deals with the development and maturation of innovative shielding able to sustain high and low energy debris associated to the engine failure. The objective of the work is to perform Impact and mechanical test on structural and non-structural shielding for aircraft, to sustain high and low energy debris impact. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Experimental characterization of turbulent pressure fluctuations on realistic Contra-Rotating Open Rotor (CROR) 2D airfoil in representative high subsonic Mach number.
results.content: Experimental characterization of turbulent pressure fluctuations on realistic Contra-Rotating Open Rotor (CROR) 2D airfoil in representative high subsonic Mach number.

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The prediction of Open Rotor broadband noise requires boundary layer turbulence statistics that are not available today in the literature at the high subsonic relative Mach number encountered by the blades. High fidelity wind tunnel tests shall be performed to fill this lack. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Erosion-resistant functional coatings
results.content: Erosion-resistant functional coatings

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The objective of this work is to define, demonstrate and apply hard erosion-resistant functional coatings on carbon fiber/epoxy test panels representing a multifunctional Natural Laminar Flow (NLF) wing skin. The applicant is responsible for testing of coating-to-panel adhesion and other basic characterization according to a test plan to be provided by the Topic Manager. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: High accuracy and low intrusiveness in-flight wing shape and temperature measurements
results.content: High accuracy and low intrusiveness in-flight wing shape and temperature measurements

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Detailed and high accuracy (approximately 20 µm) measurement of aerodynamic surface shapes is a key enabler for the future of laminar flow aerodynamics. The objective of this topic is to develop an integrated and unobtrusive measurement system providing local and global wing structural deformation and temperature data with high environmental constraints. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Tool-Part-Interaction simulation process linked to laminate quality
results.content: Tool-Part-Interaction simulation process linked to laminate quality

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Highly integrated composite structures require complex tooling with increasing physical and geometrical complexity. Factors affecting laminate quality include thermal expansion, pressure distribution, frictional effects, and their influence on the consolidation of the part. The objective of this topic is to develop a FE based model, currently not available on the market that will make it possible to simulate the complex consolidation process during the cure phase and link the result to laminate quality. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Complex (composite) part Ultrasonic inspection facilitated by man-robot collaboration
results.content: Complex (composite) part Ultrasonic inspection facilitated by man-robot collaboration

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The objective of the work is to develop the next generation NDI robot cell for scanning complex integrated composite parts. The cell is preferably equipped with off the shelf robot solutions and state of the art ultrasonic end effectors. Moreover the robot cell shall allow close interaction with an operator without jeopardizing safety aspects. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Technology evaluation of immersive technologies for in-flight applications
results.content: Technology evaluation of immersive technologies for in-flight applications

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The activities shall evaluate the use of immersive technologies (Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality) for passengers and cabin crew during flight operation. Key areas are the impacts on the well-being of passengers and crew as well as evaluating potential technology solutions and applications for ancillary revenue generation and operational efficiency. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Ice protection system based on two-phase heat transport technologies integrated in representative engine intake structure
results.content: Ice protection system based on two-phase heat transport technologies integrated in representative engine intake structure

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The Call for Proposal deals with developing an ice protection system based on two-phase heat transport technologies. The objective is to increase aircraft efficiency by integrating the system within the structure (i.e. representative engine intake structure) and by replacing the traditional ice-protection that require energy from the A/C powerplant with passive devices. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.content: HVDC Electrical Power Conversion and Distribution System Development

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

A new electrical power conversion and distribution system more efficient and reliable is needed as the dependence on electric power increases and the necessity to supply systems more critical to the safe operation of the aircraft using HVDC voltages, as, in this case, the Flight Control System actuators. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Integrated airborne antenna for satellite communications in wing – fuselage airframe fairing
results.content: Integrated airborne antenna for satellite communications in wing – fuselage airframe fairing

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

This topic describes the design, prototyping, manufacturing and testing “on ground” and “in-flight” of an airborne antenna highly integrated into the wing – fuselage airframe fairing. Main deliverables of this topic are the Regional FTB#2 wing – fuselage fairings where the antenna is integrated and operative. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Ice protection technology based on electromagnetic induction integrated in representative leading edge structure
results.content: Ice protection technology based on electromagnetic induction integrated in representative leading edge structure

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The topic scope is to develop, manufacture and test an ice protection system embedded in a composite structure based on electromagnetic induction technology. Modularity, minimum energy loss, minimum weight and adaptability to concave surfaces representative of wing leading edge are the design drivers of the topic. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: System development for optical fiber sensing technology measurements for industrial aeronautical contexts: composite manufacturing plants, structural test platforms and airborne conditions
results.content: System development for optical fiber sensing technology measurements for industrial aeronautical contexts: composite manufacturing plants, structural test platforms and airborne conditions

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The project will be focussed on the development of equipment based on distributed optical fibre sensors technology to measure and evaluate the quality and structural health of the composite parts along their different life phases. The system will integrate different acquisition modules and their corresponding interface software adapted to the needs and functionalities of each industrial context. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Prototype Manufacturing Tooling for Single Parts Manufacturing of the Rotorless tail for LifeRCraft.
results.content: Prototype Manufacturing Tooling for Single Parts Manufacturing of the Rotorless tail for LifeRCraft.

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The aim of this Call for Partner is to develop, design, manufacture and deliver to the CoP of the CfCP AIR-02-02, the prototype manufacturing toolings for all single parts of the LifeRCraft Rotorless Tail that belong to the WP_B4.1 “Rotorless Tail for LifeRCraft”. The development of this tooling should be innovative in order to implement the best performances in the following fields:
• Low Cost Materials
• Eco-design
• Energy savings
• Manufacturing processes simplification-Production time savings.
Always ensuring that each one of the single parts manufactured with the prototype tooling fit with the Aeronautical quality standards.
Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Prototype Tooling for Sub-Assembly, Final Assembly and Transport of the Rotorless tail for the Compound RC.
results.content: Prototype Tooling for Sub-Assembly, Final Assembly and Transport of the Rotorless tail for the Compound RC.

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The aim of this Call for Partner is to develop, design, manufacture and deliver to the Leader and/or the CoP of the CfCP AIR-02-02, all the prototype Assembly, Sub-Assembly and Transportation tooling needed to pre-assemble, assemble and transport the Compound RC Rotorless Tail.
The development of this tooling should be innovative in order to implement the best performances in the following fields:
• Low Cost/ Natural Materials
• Eco-design
• Energy savings
• Assembly processes simplification-Assembly time savings.
• Simplify Transportation processes.
Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment
