results.summary: Multipurpose test rig for transmission gear boxes
results.content: Multipurpose test rig for transmission gear boxes

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

To adapt an existing rig, to enable simultaneous mechanical testing of main and side gear box modules as needed for Permit to Fly of the LifeRCraft demonstrator. This rig must accomodate the non conventional mechanical architecture of this demonstrator and save energy, requiring low power input (back-to-back architecture). Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Design and realization of equipped engine compartments for a fast compound rotorcraft
results.content: Design and realization of equipped engine compartments for a fast compound rotorcraft

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The scope of this WP includes firewalls, cowlings, engine air inlet systems, engine bay ventilation and halon-free fire extinguishing system. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Fuel bladder tanks for a fast compound rotorcraft
results.content: Fuel bladder tanks for a fast compound rotorcraft

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The partner will develop the fuel system including specific full tanks and will define and conduct all system tests required to validate flightworthiness. The delivered system will be integrated in the LifeRCraft rotorcraft flight demonstrator (TRL6). Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: HVDC Generator
results.content: HVDC Generator

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

To design, develop, manufacture, test and qualify up to TRL6 a High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) controlled Generator (HVGEN) intended to be installed on Heavy Class Rotorcraft (compound or conventional helicopter) for a Flight Demonstration. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Bird strike- and erosion resistant and fast maintainable windshields
results.content: Bird strike- and erosion resistant and fast maintainable windshields

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

A complete set of windshields for the Fast Rotorcraft has to be developed, manufactured and tested. This encompasses both sides of the front area as far as the upper pilot- and the lower- windshields. The requirements for a High Speed Helicopter (min. impact on drag & max. operational performance) and the requirements for bird strike resistance according to EASA CS29 have to be fulfilled. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Active technologies for acoustic and vibration comfort
results.content: Active technologies for acoustic and vibration comfort

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

To progress on airframe efficiency while supporting the high level of the customer comfort requested, new technologies of noise and vibration reduction have to be developed to face the new evolutions of business jet design. It is proposed to develop and evaluate active technologies for 2 different problems: active control systems for reducing cabin noise from engine vibration, and active control systems for reducing global fuselage vibration from aerodynamic excitations. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Validation of aero-vibro-acoustic model on new aerodynamic configurations.
results.content: Validation of aero-vibro-acoustic model on new aerodynamic configurations.

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Due to new fuselage shape and different cruise mach numbers, this project aims at improving knowledge on turbulent boundary layer noise and its propagation into the fuselage structure. The influence of pressure gradients and fuselage shapes will be investigated through both experimental measurements and numerical simulations. Wind tunnel test on a modular mock up will provide data about aero-acoustics and structural dynamics under non homogeneous loading. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules

results.summary: Laminar Horizontal Tail Plane full scale ground demonstrator
results.content: Laminar Horizontal Tail Plane full scale ground demonstrator

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

• Participate to the design of a industrial structure of a laminar HTP taking account the laminar requirements in terms of surface quality;
• Manufacture a 2 meter span piece of this main box HTP: the demonstrator;
• Design and manufacture the HTP remote surface control
• Design and manufacture the inner extension and of this HTP to install the demonstrator for large scale wind tunnel tests at flight Reynolds numbers;
• Manufacture several partial demonstrators.
Explanation: The overall model will have a span of approximately 5m and a mean aerodynamic chord of approximately 2 m. The model will be divided into an inner (the extension) and an outer section (the demonstrator). The outer section will be instrumented with pressure ports and need to be compatible with IR measurements. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Design, test and manufacturing of robust fluidic actuators
results.content: Design, test and manufacturing of robust fluidic actuators

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Design, test and manufacturing of robust, energy-efficient, aerodynamically effective actuators without moving parts for TRL3 WTT. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Drive and control system for piezoelectric AFC actuators
results.content: Drive and control system for piezoelectric AFC actuators

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Drive and control system for piezoelectric AFC actuators. Ground Based Systems Demonstrator: Development, manufacturing and testing of a smart amplifier box for fluidic actuators with advanced monitoring capabilities. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Test aircraft preparation and qualification for Scaled Flight Testing (PREP)
results.content: Test aircraft preparation and qualification for Scaled Flight Testing (PREP)

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

This task covers modifications to the test vehicle itself, based on results from the former NACRE project and from other similar activities. The task should include planning for the changes, execution of the modifications, in cooperation with partners, and qualification of the changes as well as the complete vehicle. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Hybrid Propulsion Demonstrator Components – Electric Power Drives
results.content: Hybrid Propulsion Demonstrator Components – Electric Power Drives

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Support for Hybrid Electric Propulsion component development work, for Electric Power Drive components. This task includes design, build and test of specific components. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Hybrid Propulsion Component Studies – Electrics
results.content: Hybrid Propulsion Component Studies – Electrics

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

This task supports the Hybrid Electric Propulsion demonstration with component and architecture simulations, modellization of basic principles and break-through innovation. The focus is on electric generation, conversion and drive components. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Landing gear large die-forged fitting with improved mechanical performance
results.content: Landing gear large die-forged fitting with improved mechanical performance

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

This study aims at developing a new generation of Lower Center Fuselage, with a Body Landing Gear, in order to reduce the drag and the overall weight. The objective of this study is to develop a landing gear fitting with high mechanical properties, thanks to new generation alloys. Forged blanks geometry will be close to the final shape, in order to reduce weight, distortions and impact on the environment. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: High production rate composite Keel Beam feasibility
results.content: High production rate composite Keel Beam feasibility

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The keel beam is a highly loaded structural element located in the lower centre fuselage. The aim of this call for partner is to propose a compromise between performance and cost taking into account manufacturing needs and constraints (low cost & high volume technology). Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Integrated main landing gear bay
results.content: Integrated main landing gear bay

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

This topic aims at developing a new generation of Lower Center Fuselage, with a Body Landing Gear. This topic relates to the design of a main landing gear bay for a landing gear attached to the fuselage. The most promising solution has to be found disregarding the load compatibility, the best material utilization through a quantitative assessment, taking into account manufacturing requirement (recurring cost, high production rate, process stability…) at high level of integration for design to cost. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Development of pultrusion manufacturing applications
results.content: Development of pultrusion manufacturing applications

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Pultrusion is a rapid and continuous out of autoclave process used to simultaneously extrude and polymerize profiles. Thus, this process offers high energy savings perspectives. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Touchscreen control panel for critical system management functions
results.content: Touchscreen control panel for critical system management functions

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The purpose of this Call for Partner is to develop a touchscreen control panel that could replace standard overhead control panels as an incremental step on existing aircrafts and more globally on future cockpits. In order to address all overhead functions, the technology should be compliant with failure conditions up to CAT. Therefore, the whole control chain shall be secured from the touch sensor to the controlled system. The project should last 3 years at most and target TRL5 maturity by the end of the project thanks to a representative prototype that would be integrated on a large aircraft cockpit simulator. An extension may be decided to feed Airbus Disruptive Cockpit Demonstrator. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.

Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: New flight crew oxygen mask concept for prolonged use in civil aircraft
results.content: New flight crew oxygen mask concept for prolonged use in civil aircraft

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Current flight crew oxygen masks are not adapted to prolonged use as required for some aircraft operations. The objective of the project is to develop and validate mask solutions which would drastically increase the mask comfort for long duration while maintening safety of the crew. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
supportInfo:
Clean Sky CfP 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CFP-2015-01@Cleansky.EU

Clean Sky 2 States Representative Group Contact Points - ec.europa.eu/research/participants/data/ref/h2020/other/guides_for_applicants/jtis/h2020-srg-cleansky-ju_en.pdf

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Head Up System integration in next generation cockpits
results.content: Head Up System integration in next generation cockpits

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

The Head Up Display is now becoming more and more a standard equipment in aircraft, both for economical reasons (the cost has been reduced drastically) and because the demonstration of its benefits is now widely shared. This opens the possibility of new usages in next cockpit generation, or in the evolution of existing ones. The objective of the project is to analyze how the capacities of the Head Up Display could be used to provide new functionalities, in combination with other visualization means, and to demonstrate them on a fixed simulator. The bidder will be expected to contribute to the analysis of potential new functionalities, to prototype them in an existing Head Up System, to provide the airframer with two test equipment, including rapid prototyping capacities, and to participate to, and support, bench tests at the Airframer facilities. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.

sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in Part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.

    3.2 Submission and evaluation process:
               described in the Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for proposals
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates for the type(s) of action(s) under this call: 
    Proposal templates are accessed via the proposal submission system (SEP).
     
  7.  Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    see Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8. JTIs additional documents:
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU – Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Smart-grid converter
results.content: Smart-grid converter

descriptionByte:
Specific Challenge:

Development and prototype manufacturing of innovative High/low voltage DC/DC "resonant cellular" converter with automatic inversion for innovative "smart-grid" based electrical network. Please refer to the full and formal topic descriptions published in this call.
